medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed gross hematuria four days prior to admission, which involved passage of clots and mild dysuria, without increased urinary frequency. Symptoms worsened two days before admission, and an unsuccessful cystoscopic examination occurred on the admission day. One day before admission, urine culture showed a few mixed bacteria. The patient experienced difficulty voiding and then became unable to void the evening before admission but was able to void again after 45 minutes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Moderate hyperlipidemia; antibodies to hepatitis B viral antigen detected eight years prior; several relatives were positive for hepatitis B viral antigen.
medical_history.family_history: Several relatives were positive for hepatitis B viral antigen.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a native of Hong Kong and a student. She lost about 3.2 kg in weight over the past two months while on a low-fat diet and increased exercise. She did not use tobacco or alcohol.
